adrFormatAddress: 443 E 9th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text: Social Tees found my dream dog, a 2 year old black mouth cur from Tennessee.  I signed up to foster him and knew we were a match on the first night. I adopted him a few days later. Great experience. They put a lot of care and thoughtfulness into placing animals for adoption. If you want to rescue a dog or cat, this would be an excellent place to look. I could not be happier. Daddy loves you, Phelps.

originalText.text:
Social Tees is amazing!  We adopted our incredible pup Juniper from them in July and we could not be more impressed. They were very thorough in the application process and made sure we had plans in place for training and socialization before we brought her home. Their foster system is also fantastic. Juniper was very clearly well loved and socialized prior to our meeting her!

My mother also adopted through Social Tees and her pup is equally amazing. We are very grateful for all the joy these pups have brought to our lives.
Thank you Social Tees!

text.text:

originalText.text: I recently adopted a 6 year old Jack Russell mixed breed from Social Tees, named Ling, and couldn't have had a better experience with the team. From their volunteers, to their foster fur parent David, everyone was amazing and responsive. From picking Ling up, to follow up, they were so hands on. I left the Social Tees fully informed and prepared to care for Ling and she is such a sweet girl. We love her so much and while she is learning to trust us (she was saved from a hoarder situation) she has brought my family so much happiness. THANK YOU SOCIAL TEES - for bringing Ling into our lives, and for saving so many. What you do is incredible.

THANK YOU SOCIAL TEES - for bringing Ling into our lives, and for saving so many. What you do is incredible.

originalText.text:
I adopted my pup, Stevie, from Social Tees in June 2021. She's an extremely social girl and people on the street will always ask what rescue we used, and if we recommend them - the answer is always no. I have had dogs and worked with dogs for 25 years, and Stevie made them all look like a walk in the park. When I initially had her as a foster, I sought out help from Social Tees and they told me I was wrong, Stevie was categorically not a difficult dog. Even though they had met her for less than 5 minutes, they did not take my experiences witnessing her anxiety, reactivity, and biting into consideration. After a few weeks of fostering, I felt that I was the person best suited to continue to work with Stevie and give her a forever home. I reached out to adopt her, and was told a stranger reached out the day prior. Social Tees has arbitrary rules in place in which the person who reaches out first has "dibs". They would prefer to uproot and re-home a dog with unbelievable amounts of trauma because someone reached out to express interest a day before I did. It then fell on me, the foster parent, to interview this person. The potential adopter told me they had never had a dog, and said verbatim "I am not really a dog person" - how their application was approved for a 1 year old rescue dog with severe trauma is beyond me. They also worked 8 hour days out of home, making them a terrible match for a dog with separation anxiety. This all seemed obvious to me but I had to fight tooth and nail to convey my concerns to the Social Tees team. Funny enough, I reached out to let the team know Stevie was having a medical concern and needed to see a vet and they suddenly let me know I would be the one adopting Stevie and could go ahead pay out of pocket. I doubt Social Tees remembers Stevie or this situation, because never once did I feel like Social Tees had Stevie's best interest in mind, or that she was a priority.

I'm so grateful I got her out of that situation, where she lives happily as our number one priority. We have found Stevie the best behavioralists in the city since then, and Stevie now lives an extraordinarily life with no separation anxiety, and limited triggers.

originalText.text: The team at social tees is AMAZING. I wasn't sure if i was ready to commit to adopting a dog so I talked with social tees about becoming a foster parent. They were super helpful along the way. we did a zoom meeting for first time fosters to ask questions, get info and prepare for taking care of our fosters. Going to the pick up site at 630 am was really a special moment, you see the hard work the social tees team puts in and all the dogs they are helping to save. It was here I met my foster Patrick, a jack Russell terrier/Chihuahua mix. He was overwhelmed by his trip from Tennessee and the new city he was dropped off in, but over time he warmed up and yep, we became best friends. Only a few days after taking care of him I reached out to Social Tees to adopt him. Again, they were excellent, thorough, and helpful with the process. Even being a foster, they still made sure to properly review my application. This shows how much they care about finding great homes for their dogs. I cant thank social tees enough for matching me up with Patrick and the work the put in with every dog they save.
